article.headline: Richmond 71, Duquesne 51
article.story: PITTSBUGRH (AP) -- Mike Skrocki scored 11 points to help Richmond defeated Duquesne 71-51 on Saturday night. Richmond (13-9, 5-4 Atlantic 10) went on a 9-2 run to close out the first half and led Duquesne (9-11, 4-5) at halftime 31-24. Duquesne cut the lead to eight at 52-44 during the second half, but Richmond later went on a seven point run and coasted to the win. The Spiders had a 46-26 rebounding edge and had 21 offensive rebounds to 8 for Duquesne. Richmond also outscored Duquesne 28 to 14 in the paint and the Spiders had the advantage in second chance points 23 to 5. Richmond's suffocating defense limited Duquesne to 13 of 40 shooting, while the Spiders were 23 for 58 from the field. Tony Dobbins, Daon Merritt and Gaston Moliva scored 10 points apiece for the Spiders. Martin Osimani led Duquesne with 10 points.
